lexUnit.name: entertain.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: provide with amusement or enjoyment.

sentence.text: The responsibility of entertaining his daughter seemed awesome .
All of the people who were going to entertain these friends were there to greet them .
( Harry had decided that to pay for entertaining Nadine Cunningham would be to add insult to injury . )
After a wine reception Tracy entertained her audience with a lively lecture and slide presentation on the voyage and the evening raised over Â£4,000 .
In breaks in our work Edward entertained me with curious stories of the old alchemists .
When the tables had been cleared and those who could do so had entertained the rest with songs and recitations , the whole company settled down for a sing-song .
While Violette entertained them with stories of increasing complexity , Katherine from beneath lowered lids stole occasional glances at Carlo .

A former Sarajevo University professor who entertained his students by brandishing a pistol during lectures , Mr Seselj came to prominence in Belgrade as a critic of communism , though he himself is an ex-communist .
` And I do not intend to entertain you by dressing while you watch . "
Each of the group members presents one of the units , and takes it in turn to entertain their fellow travellers by talking about their interests in life or about their travels .
As Cynthia says : ` We found Dave entertaining children at Chessington World of Adventures , and in 25 years I had never met anyone who got on more naturally with children . "
Groups of children sometimes can invent games of their own , or maybe entertain themselves in their own way if they are free of adult interference .
Frances and Miles went off to the kitchen to do the washing-up ( and , no doubt , to talk annuities ) , leaving Charles to entertain the children .
` Entertain her , " he said .
The three of them are sitting round a low table with three cups of coffee , and Paul is trying to entertain the visitor .
Of course , Jamila would be entertained by that .
While waiting to order we were entertained by the sight of a bookish American muttering : ` You got ta try this !
During the lunchtime break those present were entertained by the Margate Drum Majorettes , one hundred balloons were released and a raffle was drawn .
Before the official start to the proceedings , staff were entertained by a recording of the Gerry Rafferty song , Right Next Time .
Again , she felt she was only entertaining him as he might have been entertained by a clever child .
We played two games that day at Prescott Club and we were entertained after dinner by a Fiddlers Rally -- a superb day .
During the evening , not only did we sit down to an excellent meal but we were also entertained .
The event attracted 250 pupils during the afternoon session , and a further 180 people ( pupils , parents and RSC members ) were entertained in the evening .
It entertained me watching you try .
He smiled , apparently entertained by her reluctance to be manipulated , and , taking a seat opposite , said , ` I , however , will tell you everything you need to know . "
